result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clinton A Jones

records.addlTxt: 02:05 PM Cases 20CF47 and 22CF64 called together.  Defendant, Clinton A Jones, appeared with Attorney David L. Christian.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Case 22CF64 was set for prelim, but that matter is to be DRI, parties stipulate that a WOPH isn't needed in that matter.  Case 20CF47 is on for Plea Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Court from PLQ, def pleading to 1 count of failure to support, parties requesting PSI, parties free to argue.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Discussion of no contest/guilty pleas.  Def to plead guilty.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 and orders a JOC; remaining charges and case 22CF64 are DRI.  Court orders PSI, long form, agent does not need to be present, but should be available by phone- if needed- for sentencing hearing.  Bond continues.  No restitution request.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:42 AM Cases 22CF64 and 20CF47 called together.  Defendant, Clinton A Jones, appeared with Attorney David L. Christian.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Case 22CF64 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  WTLPH.  Case 20CF47 on for final pre-trial.  Atty Christian updates- agreement reached, def pleading to Ct 1, DRI other count, PSI to be requested; will file the PLQ and get a date set.  Court to remove the jury trial for 5/3/22.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Petition for leave to file additional motions
Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant

All previously posted cash has been forfeited.  Defendant shall appear on time for all court appearances.  Obtain and maintain gainful employment.  Pay at least $200 per month towards child support.  No contact with the victim or their residence. The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.
